thread.title: Quadrant Energy's long game

author: afr.com
title: Quadrant Energy's long game
text:
Macquarie Capital's plans for Quadrant Energy are already a talking point in the market. by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald How long before the smart types at Macquarie begin preparing their new gas arm Quadrant Energy for the ASX-boards?
We are not saying it will happen this year - or even in 2016 - but it already shapes as the logical exit strategy for Macquarie Capital and partner Brookfield Asset Management.
Sure, it is hard to think about a multi-billion dollar oil and gas float in the current market. But if Macquarie is right, equity investors will return to the sector and the window will re-open at some time in the next few years. When it does, Quadrant will be a contender. It's already a talking point in some parts of the market.
Macquarie's no stranger to such deals and now Quadrant is on the bank's balance sheet, there is sure to be some significant brainpower mapping out its future.
As Street Talk reported on Monday, Quadrant is in talks to acquire a bunch of Western Australian assets from joint venture partner Santos, with a deal slated for later this month.
Quadrant and Santos' jointly held WA assets include the Reindeer offshore gas field and the Devil Creek onshore gas processing plant, as well as the offshore Stag oil platform and the John Brookes and Spar gas and condensates ventures.
